docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Commands

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: How to Make a Mobile Robot This is a blog like introduction to the steps and component in making a robot. It is made for us as a reminder of all the processes and for everyone who wants to get into building your own mobile robot. Table of contents: Robot Components Robot Model Assembling the Robot Robot Components Information on the components used for this mobile robot can be found in the Robot Components documentation. Robot Model Information on the CAD model used in this project can be found in the Robot Model documentation. Assembling the Robot The frame Saw the laths to length. Using angle brackets and the 4 frame pieces, assemble the frame. Saw the board to size. With screws attach the board as flooring to the frame. Drivetrain Follow instructions from Flipsky on how to assemble the drivetrain.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.title: Assembling the Robot

docs.text: Robot model This contains information and 3d models of the robot we are about to build. Wheels: All Terrain Honeycomb Wheels Size:6'' ATM d=150mm, w=50mm Wheel bearing:608RS Pulley bearing:6900RS Pulley Teeth: 60T Belt:335mm, 15mm Width Material:Nylon Motors: Flipsky BLDC Belt Motor Battle Hardened 6374 KV: 190KV Max Power: 3500Watts Max Current: 85 Amps Max Volts: 12S Max Torque: 8Nm Motor Resistance: 0.05Ohm Recommend ESC: 3-12S 50A (FSESC4.12 50A or FSESC 6.6 60A) The number of pole: 14 Net weight: 980g Motor wire:12AWG Shaft size : 10mm Battery: 6-21S 100A UART BT, Li-ion. 13 Cells (11 in series, 2 in parrallel) 5.0 Ah small blog on the battery components Battery management system: JBD Smart BMS 6~21S
docs.title: Robot Model
